citing_paper_authors: Maarten van, Gompel | Antal, van den Bosch
raw_text: We used the method of extraction by Ng and Lee (1996) and encoded all keywords in a binary bag of words model
clean_text: We used the method of extraction by Ng and Lee (1996) and encoded all keywords in a binary bag of words model.

raw_text: Likewise, (Ng and Lee, 1996) report overall accuracy for the noun interest of 87%, and find that that when their feature set only consists of co? occurrence features the accuracy only drops to 80%
clean_text: Likewise, (Ng and Lee, 1996) report overall accuracy for the noun interest of 87%, and find that that when their feature set only consists of co-occurrence features the accuracy only drops to 80%.

raw_text: Prior research (e.g., (McRoy, 1992), (Ng and Lee, 1996), (Stevenson and Wilks, 2001), (Yarowsky and Florian, 2002)) suggests that use of both syntactic and lexical features will improve disambiguation accuracies
Further, some of the work (e.g., (McRoy, 1992), (Ng and Lee, 1996)) suggests that using both kinds of features may result in significantly higher accuracies as compared to individual results

Previous experiments (Ng and Lee, 1996) have explored the relative contribution of different knowledge sources to WSD and have concluded that col locational information is more important than syntactic information
clean_text: Previous experiments (Ng and Lee, 1996) have explored the relative contribution of different knowledge sources to WSD and have concluded that collocational information is more important than syntactic information.

raw_text: The DSO collection (Ng and Lee, 1996) focuses on 191 frequent and polysemous words (nouns and verbs), and contains around 1,000 sentences per word
clean_text: The DSO collection (Ng and Lee, 1996) focuses on 191 frequent and polysemous words (nouns and verbs), and contains around 1,000 sentences per word.

raw_text: Exemplar-based method makes use of typical contexts (exemplars) of a word sense ,e.g., verb noun collocations or adjective-noun collocations, and identifies the correct sense of a word in a particular context by comparing the context with the exemplars (Ng and Lee, 1996)
clean_text: Exemplar-based method makes use of typical contexts (exemplars) of a word sense, e.g., verb noun collocations or adjective-noun collocations, and identifies the correct sense of a word in a particular context by comparing the context with the exemplars (Ng and Lee, 1996).

raw_text: Moreover, the effectiveness of this method on disambiguating words in large-scale corpora into fine-grained sense distinctions needs to be further investigated (Ng and Lee, 1996)
clean_text: Moreover, the effectiveness of this method on disambiguating words in large-scale corpora into fine-grained sense distinctions needs to be further investigated (Ng and Lee, 1996).

citing_paper_authors: Yee Seng, Chan | Hwee Tou, Ng | Zhi, Zhong
raw_text: Hence, besides gathering examples from the widely usedSEMCOR corpus, we also gathered training examples from 6 English-Chinese parallel corpora and the DSO corpus (Ng and Lee, 1996)
clean_text: Hence, besides gathering examples from the widely usedSEMCOR corpus, we also gathered training examples from 6 English-Chinese parallel corpora and the DSO corpus (Ng and Lee, 1996).

citing_paper_authors: Yee Seng, Chan | Hwee Tou, Ng | Zhi, Zhong
raw_text: Besides SEMCOR, the DSO corpus (Ng and Lee, 1996) also contains manually annotated examples for WSD
clean_text: Besides SEMCOR, the DSO corpus (Ng and Lee, 1996) also contains manually annotated examples for WSD.

citing_paper_authors: Antal, van den Bosch | Iris, Hendrickx | Véronique, Hoste | Walter, Daelemans
raw_text: Our approach to memory-based all-words WSD follows the memory based approach of (Ng and Lee, 1996), and the work by (Veenstra et al, 2000) on a memory based approach to the English lexical sample task of SENSEVAL-1
clean_text: Our approach to memory-based all-words WSD follows the memory based approach of (Ng and Lee, 1996), and the work by (Veenstra et al, 2000) on a memory based approach to the English lexical sample task of SENSEVAL-1.

citing_paper_authors: Antal, van den Bosch | Iris, Hendrickx | Véronique, Hoste | Walter, Daelemans
raw_text: The keywords were selected through a selection method suggested by (Ng and Lee, 1996) within three sentences around the ambiguous word; only content words were used as candidates
clean_text: The keywords were selected through a selection method suggested by (Ng and Lee, 1996) within three sentences around the ambiguous word; only content words were used as candidates.

citing_paper_authors: Ping, Chen | Wei, Ding | Chris, Bowes | David, Brown
raw_text: In the fol lowing testing phase, a word is classified into senses (Mihalcea, 2002) (Ng and Lee, 1996)
clean_text: In the following testing phase, a word is classified into senses (Mihalcea, 2002) (Ng and Lee, 1996).

raw_text: This feature set is similar to the one used by (Ngand Lee, 1996), as well as by a number of state-of the-art word sense disambiguation systems participating in the SENSEVAL-2 and SENSEVAL-3evaluations
clean_text: This feature set is similar to the one used by (Ngand Lee, 1996), as well as by a number of state-of the-art word sense disambiguation systems participating in the SENSEVAL-2 and SENSEVAL-3evaluations.

raw_text: The high accuracy of the LEXAS system (Ng and Lee, 1996) is due in part to the use of large corpora
clean_text: The high accuracy of the LEXAS system (Ng and Lee, 1996) is due in part to the use of large corpora.

clean_text: The disambiguation is then done using k-NN (Ng and Lee, 1996) where the k nearest neighbors of the test sentence are identified using this scoring function.

raw_text: The idea of using supervised machine learning for WSD is not new and was used for example in (Ng and Lee, 1996)
clean_text: The idea of using supervised machine learning for WSD is not new and was used for example in (Ng and Lee, 1996).

raw_text: We report results of comparing our lexicon with theWordNet cousins as well as the inter-annotator disagreement observed between two semantically an notated corpora: WordNet Semcor (Landes et al, 1998) and DSO (Ng and Lee, 1996)
clean_text: We report results of comparing our lexicon with theWordNet cousins as well as the inter-annotator disagreement observed between two semantically an notated corpora: WordNet Semcor (Landes et al, 1998) and DSO (Ng and Lee, 1996).

raw_text: DisagreementTo test if the sense partitions in our lexicon constitute an appropriate (or useful) level of granularity, we applied it to the inter-annotator disagreement observed in two semantically annotated corpora: WordNet Semcor (Landes et al, 1998) and DSO (Ng and Lee, 1996)
clean_text: To test if the sense partitions in our lexicon constitute an appropriate (or useful) level of granularity, we applied it to the inter-annotator disagreement observed in two semantically annotated corpora: WordNet Semcor (Landes et al, 1998) and DSO (Ng and Lee, 1996).

raw_text: The set of features de ned for the training of the system is described in gure 1, and is based on the feature selection made by Ng and Lee (1996) and Escudero et al (2000)
